required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remotely Monitoring Patients With Chronic Conditions in Their Home
clinical_study.official_title: Necklace-Shaped Sensor for Non-Invasive Measurement of Vital Signs, Thoracic Impedance, ECG, Skin Temperature and Motion

brief_summary.textblock: Study will collect data from the home using the CoVa Monitoring System. Data will be captured and retrospectively analysis to determine if the data provided can alert clinician about a patient's declining health.

detailed_description.textblock: Study will collect data from the home using the CoVa Monitoring System. Data will be captured and retrospectively analysis to determine if the data provided can alert clinician about a patient's declining health. Data from the CoVa Monitoring System will be compared against electronic health records to determine if the data captured will provide insight into a patient's overall health. Additionally, user compliance will be monitored

primary_outcome.description: Correlation between data collection and potential heart failure event

arm_group.description: This cohort is living at home with a chronic condition.

intervention.description: Subject will be instructed to discontinuation of use of device

study_pop.textblock: Patients receiving home health care with one or more chronic diseases including CHF

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic Disease including CHF
- Currently receiving home health care
- Recent discharge for a CHF event
Exclusion Criteria:
- Skin reaction to electrodes
- Inability to take measurements due to low BMI
